definition: stinking intellectual (contemptuous term for educated people during the Cultural Revolution)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Capitalism is a term invented by Karl Marx.
sentences.chinese: “四人幫”創造了一個名詞叫“臭老九”。

sentences.english: The Gang of Four labelled intellectuals the "stinking Number Nine".
sentences.chinese: “四人幫”創造了一個名詞叫“臭老九”。

sentences.english: That word is a recent coinage.
sentences.chinese: “四人幫”創造了一個名詞叫“臭老九”。

definition: capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)

(category defined by the Communist Party) poor and lower-middle peasants: farmers who, before land reform, possessed little or no land (poor peasants) and those who were barely able to support themselves with their own land (lower-middle peasants)
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
to seize and subject to public criticism (form of persecution during the Cultural Revolution)
the “five red categories” (Cultural Revolution term), i.e. poor and lower-middle peasants, workers, revolutionary soldiers, revolutionary cadres, and revolutionary martyrs
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
